meanings.definition: In a stocky manner; thickly or robustly built.
meanings.sent1: He walked stockily, with a strong and sturdy gait.
meanings.sent2: The boxer stood stockily in the ring, ready for the match.
meanings.sent3: The bear danced stockily, trying to impress the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The old tree trunk stood stockily in the middle of the forest, a symbol of strength.
meanings.sent5: The castle walls were built stockily, able to withstand any attack.

meanings.definition: In a solid and sturdy manner.
meanings.sent1: She held onto the railing stockily as the ship rocked on the waves.
meanings.sent2: The house was built stockily, able to endure harsh weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The robot moved stockily, as if it had just woken up from a long nap.
meanings.sent4: The mountain stood stockily against the horizon, unmoving and majestic.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge was constructed stockily, ensuring safe passage for all travelers.
